meanings.definition: A graph showing the variation of a variable against time.
meanings.sent1: The oscillograms displayed the changes in temperature over the course of the day.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use oscillograms to study how the heart rate changes during exercise.
meanings.sent3: The oscillograms at the science fair danced with colorful lines that moved up and down.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like oscillograms, fluctuating wildly throughout the rollercoaster ride.
meanings.sent5: The teacher drew oscillograms on the board to help students understand the concept visually.

meanings.definition: A visual representation of an oscillation or wave.
meanings.sent1: The artist created beautiful oscillograms of sound waves using different colors.
meanings.sent2: The oscillograms on the screen showed the vibrations of the guitar strings.
meanings.sent3: The oscillograms on the computer screen seemed to be dancing to the music playing in the background.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like oscillograms of joy reverberating in the air.
meanings.sent5: The oscillograms of the ocean waves crashing against the shore were mesmerizing to watch.
